intro: Lappula squarrosa var. erecta, commonly known as the erect lappula, is a flowering plant native to Eurasia. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, characterized by its herbaceous growth habit and distinctive seed pods. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as fields and roadsides. Its leaves are lanceolate and often covered with fine hairs, while the flowers are small and yellowish. The erecta variety is distinguished by its upright growth form compared to other varieties of lappula.
